channel.title: POLITICO Pulse
channel.description: Delivered daily by 10 a.m., Pulse examines the latest news in health care politics and policy.

item.title: Trump team boasts $12B Medicare drug savings
item.description: The Trump administration is touting $12 billion in federal savings in Medicare’s second year of drug price negotiations.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Trump health plan raises key questions
item.description: President Donald Trump was set to release his new health care plan on Monday afternoon, but the White House delayed the unveiling amid GOP pushback to the proposal.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: White House to pitch health care plan
item.description: The White House is expected to unveil a plan this week to address health cost spikes.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: CDC's vaccine pivot draws varied reactions
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: ‘Trench warfare’ on health care
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Senate looks to address health costs
item.description: Congressional Democrats are pushing for an extension of expiring Obamacare subsidies to address rising health care costs for Americans.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Republicans’ subsidy stakes
item.description: A growing number of right-leaning advocacy organizations are cautioning Republicans against letting enhanced Obamacare subsidies expire at year’s end.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: States await an ACA subsidy decision
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Where vaccine support stands
item.description: Routine vaccinations remain popular across political parties, though a significant sector — while still a minority — is vaccine-skeptical.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Post-shutdown health care reckoning begins
item.description: House Republicans voted Wednesday to end the shutdown — passing a deal negotiated in the Senate to fully fund the government through Jan. 30.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: MAHA convenes in Washington
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Digging into Trump’s health care idea
item.description: President Donald Trump’s proposal Saturday to give cash directly to Americans to purchase health coverage of their choice suggests Republicans might be open to a deal
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Shutdown deal reached as Dems drop health care demand
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: A plan to end the shutdown
item.description: Majority Leader John Thune has a plan to end the shutdown — that, seemingly, does not involve extending the enhanced Affordable Care Act Subsidies.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: Jeffries to Senate Dems: ‘Hold the line’
item.description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries told Democrats on a caucus call Wednesday afternoon they would continue “to urge the Senate to stay the course and hold the line” as the government shutdown drags on.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Sticker shock looms for health insurance buyers
item.description: Obamacare enrollees aren’t the only ones likely to experience sticker shock over the next few weeks, when they see what they’ll be paying out of pocket in health coverage premiums next year.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: House quartet floats ACA subsidy compromise
item.description: A bipartisan group of four House lawmakers outlined a “statement of principles” Monday for a compromise to extend Affordable Care Act subsidies, proposing a two-year sunset and an income-based eligibility cap.
item.dc:creator: By Simon J. Levien, Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Simon J. Levien, Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: From Warp Speed to COVAX: An insider’s story
item.description: A look into COVAX.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: On the cusp of ACA open enrollment
item.description: Saturday marks the first day that individuals who buy health insurance through the Affordable Care Act marketplace can purchase plans.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Casey Means' labor delays confirmation hearing
item.description: President Donald Trump’s surgeon general pick, Casey Means, is expected to face senators today for a confirmation hearing, and she’s likely to have a friendly reception from Republicans on the Senate health committee.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Recalled HHS staff to process rural health funds
item.description: HHS is delegating some recalled furloughed staffers to process applications for a piece of a $50 billion fund Congress created this summer to transform rural health care.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Expiring ACA subsidies: The GOP vulnerabilities
item.description: Not all House Republicans in the toughest races are ready to extend expiring subsidies that could help avoid Obamacare premium hikes for next year.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: DOGE-style layoffs are here to stay
item.description: As a result of shutdown layoffs, 954 HHS staffers are set to lose their jobs.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: GOP conflicted on solution to rising premiums
item.description: The Obamacare enrollment period — when the looming premium hike will become evident as enrollees shop for plans — is fast approaching. Republicans still don’t have a unified strategy.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: The skin-substitute debate
item.description: Medicare spending on pricey skin substitutes is expected to balloon by about 50 percent by the end of 2025.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: The health care industry’s lobbying spree
item.description: The health care industry is investing record amounts in Washington’s lobbying corridor.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: 3 health insurance trends to watch
item.description: Major health insurers will report their third-quarter earnings over the next few weeks, and investors will be closely watching for signs of distress amid a bevy of regulatory and financial hurdles plaguing the sector.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Western nations backpedal on global health
item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu, Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Amanda Chu, Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: ‘The ship has sailed’
item.description: Time is running out for Congress to act on the expiring enhanced Affordable Care Act tax credits before the start of open enrollment on Nov. 1.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: A firing mix-up explained
item.description: A federal judge put HHS’s downsizing on hold Wednesday, a day after the department told the court it had made a mistake in firing 800 of the 1,760 people it sent layoff notices to on Friday.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
